entry.title: About
entry.content:
About Me

I am a first-year Ph.D. student at EECS of University of California Merced, supervised by Prof. Meng Tang.

Previously, I received my M.S. degree in EE at University of Southern California, working with EESSC.
I received my B.S. degree in Digital Media Technology at Chongqing University of Posts and Telecommunications, supervised by Prof. Chenqiang Gao.

My research interests are computer vision and efficient deep learning. More specifically,

  • Generative Vision-Language Models
  • Efficient Deep Learning
  • Neural Architecture Search
  • Infrared Image Processing
  • Small Object Detection

I am actively looking for Research Internship in Summer 2024.

News

  • One paper accepted by AAAI Edge Intelligence workshop 2024.
  • One paper accepted by IEEE Transactions on Image Processing.
  • Best Masters Poster Award of the 11th Annual Research Festival by USC Ming Hsieh Institute.

Internships

  • Intel AI Lab (May 2022 - Jan. 2023)
